sentences.english: Kennedy was not present at the White House ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 甘迺迪没有出席在白宫举行的授勋仪式。

sentences.english: His grandfather was decorated for winning the battle.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父因赢得这一战役而被授勋。

sentences.english: The soldier was decorated for bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这名战士因勇敢而被授勋。

sentences.english: The general decorated the soldier for his brave act.
sentences.chinese: 这位将军授勋于该战士，表彰他的英勇行为。

sentences.english: I decorated an american officer for gallantry .
sentences.chinese: 我给一个勇敢的美国军官授勋。

sentences.english: The president decorated five soldiers for extraordinary bravery in battle.
sentences.chinese: 总统给在战争中表现异常勇敢的五位战士授勋。

sentences.english: The first Investiture of the Queen's reign took place at Buckingham Palace on 27th February 1952.
sentences.chinese: 第一次授勋仪式是1952年2月27日在白金汉宫。

sentences.english: He was also, at the time of his reign, themost bemedalled ruler in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在其执政期间，他是全球授勋最多的统治者。

definition: to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
